Intent Description: The requester wants information on the status of their account verification. This can include identity verification, bank account verification, or general account validation. They may be experiencing delays in the verification process, having trouble with document submission, or seeking to confirm the status of their verification. For example, "Why is my account verification taking so long?" or "I've submitted my documents, but my account isn't verified yet.".

This is a system-generated message informing the user to activate their newly created account for a service or platform. They've typically received an email with instructions and a link to complete the activation process. For example, "Please click the 'Activate' button to finish your account activation." or "To activate your account, please follow this link.".

The requester wants to delete or close their account. They may use various terms like "cancel" "close" or "remove" their account. Reasons can vary, including no longer needing the service, privacy concerns, or account security issues. For example, "I want to delete my account entirely." or "Please close this account as I don't use your services.".

The requester wants to understand how their data or their users' data is handled, protected, and used. They may ask about compliance with specific regulations (like GDPR or HIPAA), data retention policies, data transfer practices, or security measures. For example, "What's your policy on data retention?" or "Is your service HIPAA compliant?".

The requester is providing documents that were requested by the organization. The type of documents sent are typically not mentioned by the requester, because it is a response to a certain files request. For example, "Here are the documents you requested for my university." or "I've attached the required documents for my reimbursement application.".

The requester wants to combine two or more of their accounts into one. This could be to consolidate purchase history, loyalty points, or access to services across different platforms or email addresses. For example, "Can you merge my two profiles on the mobile app and website?" or "I accidentally created multiple accounts and want to combine them.".

The requester wants to know why their account is inaccessible. They often describe their account as blocked or locked. For example, "Why is my account locked?" or "Can you tell me why my account was blocked?".

The requester wants to reactivate their account or regain access to a previously deactivated account. This may include accounts that have been inactive for a while, accidentally deactivated. For example, "Can you please reactivate my account?" or "I'd like to regain access to my old account.".

The requester wants to regain access to their account that has been closed, deleted or compromised. They may need help resolving account suspension issues, or reopening a previously closed account. For example, "My account has been compromised and I can't log in." or "I want to reopen my closed account.".

The requester wants to reset their account due to problems during account creation or account customization issues. They may need guidance on the reset process or information about the consequences of resetting, such as data loss or the need to reconfigure settings and permissions. For example, "I'd like to reset my account." or "I'm having issues while trying to reset my account.".

The requester can't access their account due to it being blocked, locked, or disabled. They want to regain access to their account. For example, "My account has been locked, can you help me unlock it?" or "I'm unable to log in because my account is blocked.".

The requester wants to verify the current status of their account, including whether it's active, functional, or ready for use. For example, "Is my account open again yet?" or "Has an account been set up for the doctor?".

The requester wants to change the email address associated with their account. They may need to update their email due to a typo, losing access to their old email, or switching to a new email provider. For example, "I entered the wrong email when I created my account." or "I no longer have access to the email I used to register.".
The requester wants to update their account or login identifier. This can include changing their username. For example, "I need to change my username." or "How can I change my account login?".

The requester wants to change or correct their name in the system. This could be due to a name change after marriage, correcting a misspelling, changing the order of first and last names or adjusting capitalization. For example, "I need to change my surname after getting married." or "My first and last names are in the wrong order in the system.".

The requester wants to change their physical contact address. This could be for various accounts or services, such as insurance policies, loyalty cards, or official records. They may need assistance if they're unable to update the address themselves online or through an app. For example, "I've recently moved and need to change the address on my loyalty card." or "Can you please update my address in your system?".

The requester wants to extend the expiration date of a temporary or staff account. They typically provide the account holder's name, account number or username, current expiry date, and the desired extension period. For example, "Can you extend the account of the following employee until the end of December?" or "Please extend the following user's account for another year.".

The requester wants to report fraudulent activity, scams, or suspicious behavior on the platform. This can include sellers with multiple accounts, fake listings, unauthorized account creation, or attempts to conduct transactions outside the platform. For example, "someone is using my photos to sell fake items." or "I received an email about an account I didn't create.".

The requester wants to create a new account or register for a service. This could be for personal use, business purposes, or on behalf of someone else. For example, "I want to register my account." or "Can you help me set up an account for this new user?".

The requester is trying to create a new account or set up an existing one but is encountering difficulties. They may be experiencing technical issues, error messages, or confusion about the registration process. For example, "I can't create an account." or "I'm getting an error when trying to register.".

The requester wants to obtain a statement or detailed record of their account activity. This can include deposit and withdrawal histories, transaction lists, or financial summaries. For example, "Can I get a full deposit and withdrawal statement for 2022?" or "Please send me a lifetime transaction history of my account.".
The requester wants to get a refund for a product, service, or charge. For example, "I canceled my order and need a refund." or "I was charged incorrectly, how can I request a refund?".
The requester wants to cancel their subscription, membership, abonnement, trial or service. For example, "Please cancel my monthly subscription.".

Intent Name: Subscription payment not reflected in system
Intent Description: The requester is experiencing problems with their subscription or payment not being reflected correctly in their account. This can include payments not showing up, subscriptions not activating, or features remaining locked despite payment. For example, "I paid for premium but my account still shows as free." or "My subscription was renewed but I'm getting errors saying it's expired.".
The requester wants to know when their subscription, membership, or service period ends. For example, "When does my current subscription expire?" or "What's the end date of my premium service?".

The requester wants to understand or dispute an unexpected charge or debit to their account. They may be seeking an explanation, suspecting fraud, or questioning the validity of the transaction. For example, "Can you explain this payment on my account?".

The requester wants to understand specific admission requirements, for instance language proficiency requirements for their application. They may have questions about required test scores, transcript submission, program-specific requirements. For example, "What documents are required for my application, and how should I submit them?".

Intent Name: What is the admission application process
Intent Description: The requester wants information about how to apply or register for a program, course, or study opportunity. They may ask about application procedures, for example "What's the application process for the master's program?".

The requester wants to inquire about the current status of their admission application to an educational institution. They're seeking specific information regarding whether their application has been accepted, rejected, or is still under review. For example, "Has my application been received?" or "When can I expect a decision on my application?".

The requester wants to change information on an application they've already submitted. This could include correcting errors, updating details, or changing preferences. For example, "I entered the wrong date of birth on my university application." or "I need to change my college preferences.".
The requester wants to enroll in an educational course. This can include submitting entry forms, asking for manual enrollment. For example, "Can you enroll me in the self-study course?".

The requester is experiencing difficulties with course enrollment, and seeks assistance to complete the process. For example: "I'm unable to enroll in the course even though I meet the eligibility requirements. When I attempted to enroll, I received an error message".

The requester wants to know how long a course or program takes to complete. They may ask about total course hours, duration of individual lessons, time to finish if studying full-time, or specific start and end dates. For example, "How many hours is the Mobile Technology course?" or "How long does it take to complete one module on average?".

The requester wants to learn about the classes and programs they can enroll in at the institution they're addressing. For example, "Are there any online master's degree programs available?" or "What courses are offered for exchange students?".

The requester wants to obtain information about their class schedule, timetable, or course start dates. They might be asking when classes begin, where to find their schedule, or have questions about specific dates, or times on their timetable. For example, "When do my classes start?" or "Where can I find my course schedule?".

The requester wants to choose courses or subjects for their academic program. They may be asking about the course selection process, or the number of subjects they can take. For example, "When do I choose my classes for the semester?" or "How many subjects should I select as an exchange student?".

The requester wants to obtain detailed information about specific courses, study programs, or syllabi. They may be seeking course outlines, reading lists, module descriptions. For example, "Can you send me the syllabus for modern history course?" or "Where can I find the course content for next semester's classes?".

The requester wants to switch to a different course, module, program, or degree track. They may be seeking information on how to make the change, requesting assistance with the transfer process, or inquiring about the possibility of switching. For example, "Can I change from Data Analytics to Data Science course?" or "I'd like to transfer from Advanced Strategy to Strategic Management.".

The requester wants to extend their access time to a course, program, or course materials. They may need more time due to personal circumstances, health issues, work commitments, or other reasons. For example, "Can I have a 2-week extension on my digital marketing bootcamp?" or "Is it possible to extend my course access until May 2024?".

The requester wants to resume a course or program they previously enrolled in but didn't complete. They may have stopped due to various reasons such as health issues, work commitments, or personal matters. For example, "How can I reactivate my expired course?" or "I want to resume my studies after a break.".

The requester wants to withdraw, cancel, or discontinue their participation in a program, course, or enrollment. Reasons for withdrawal may include personal circumstances, health issues, relocation, or changes in plans. For example, "I need to withdraw from my university program." or "How do I cancel my child's school enrollment?".

The requester wants to obtain an official academic document, such as a transcript, or grade report. They may need this for various purposes including university applications, job applications, visa processes, or credit transfers. For example, "Can I get a transcript of my fall semester grades?" or "I need a sealed copy of my A-level results for my US university application.".

The requester wants to obtain a certificate, diploma, or other official documentation proving their completion of a course, degree, or program. They may need this for various purposes such as job applications, visa requirements, or proof of qualifications. For example, "Can I get a copy of my graduation certificate?" or "How do I request an end-of-study certificate for my visa application?".

The requester needs official documentation confirming their enrollment at the institution. This could be for various purposes such as visa applications, health insurance, loan verification, military service exemption, or housing. For example, "I need proof that I'm a student for my visa application." or "Can you provide an enrollment certificate for my landlord?".

The requester is sending their academic transcript or have it sent to another institution. This can be for various purposes such as completing an application, meeting offer conditions, or updating their academic record. For example, "I need to send my transcript to complete my application." or "Can you please forward my certified transcript to the university I'm applying to?".

The requester wants to submit a form to withdraw from their course or program. They may attach the completed withdrawal form to their message or notify the administration about their decision to withdraw. For example, "Here is my withdrawal form." or "Please find attached my permanent withdrawal form.".

The requester wants to submit their learning agreement. They may be exchange students requiring approval for course selections, changes to their initial agreement, or as part of a scholarship application. For example, "Please find attached a copy of my learning agreement to be signed by the home university.".

The requester wants to retake an exam, test, or quiz. This could be due to failing the first attempt, technical issues, wanting to improve their score, or missing the original test date. For example, "Can I retake the test I failed?" or "How do I redo the exam for this course?".

The requester wants to know when and how to access their exam, test, or course results. They may be asking about the release date, the method to view scores, or requesting specific score information. For example, "When will my results be available?" or "How can I see my final exam grades?".

The requester wants their grade, score, or assessment to be re-evaluated or corrected. They believe there may have been an error in grading, a misunderstanding of their submission, or a technical issue that affected their score. For example, "I think there's a mistake in my exam results." or "Can you please recheck my exam results? I don't think they're accurate.".

The requester wants to understand their grades, exam results, or the grading process. They may be asking about grade thresholds, score calculations, retake policies, or clarification on unexpected results. For example, "Why did I receive this grade?" or "How are my final scores calculated?".

The requester wants to know specific details about their upcoming graduation ceremony. They're typically asking for the exact date, time, or confirmation of previously provided information. For example, "When is the Economics graduation this summer?" or "Can you confirm the graduation dates for July?".

The requester wants information about the eligibility criteria for scholarships. They may ask where to find information about eligibility and what the different eligibility criteria are. For example, "Am I eligible for the scholarship?" or "I'm writing to inquire about the eligibility criteria for a scholarship?".

The requester wants information about scholarship opportunities, including the types of scholarships available, such as athletic scholarships, minority scholarships, or others. For example, "Do you offer scholarships to international students?".

The requester wants information about transferring to a different educational institution or campus. They may be seeking details on the transfer process, eligibility criteria, required documentation, or deadlines. For example, "How can I transfer from my current university to another university?" or "What's the process for transferring my child to a different educational institution?".

The requester wants to know about specific fees, scholarships, or financial aspects of their education. They may be asking about tuition costs, application fees, late entry fees, continuation fees, or scholarship details. For example, "What is the tuition cost for next semester?".
The requester wants to confirm if a financial transaction has been successful. For example, "Could you verify if my transfer in the amount has been successful.".

The requester wants to stop receiving unwanted emails, text messages, or other forms of communication from the company. They may ask to unsubscribe, be removed from mailing lists, or simply request that the company stops contacting them. For example, "Please remove us from your mailing list." or "Stop sending me those messages.".

The requester wants to be contacted by a representative of the company. The requester does not specify the means of contact. They may need to discuss account issues, follow up on previous communications, address product problems, seek assistance with purchases, or request information about services. For example, "Can someone get in touch with me about my order?" or "Please contact me to discuss my account.".

The requester wants to be contacted specifically by phone by a representative of the company. They may have complex issues, technical problems, or questions that are difficult to resolve through other channels. For example, "Can someone please call me?" or "I need to speak to someone on the phone regarding my account.".

Intent Name: Request to contact specific person or role
Intent Description: The requester wants to get in touch with a specific person or department within an organization. They're often looking for contact information for roles such as account managers, HR representatives, marketing leads, or other specialized positions. For example, "Can you provide me with the contact details for your HR manager?" or "Who's the right person to discuss our account?".

The requester wants to submit a formal complaint about a product, service, or company behavior. The message can also be a notice from a third-party about a new complaint that has been filed and needs to be processed. This can include issues with purchases, customer service experiences, policy changes, or perceived unfair treatment. For example, "I want to complain about a faulty product." or "I need to file a complaint against my manager.".

The requester is sending a request for feedback about a recent customer support interaction, most often in an automated format of a customer satisfaction survey. For example, "We'd love to hear what you think of our customer service. How would you rate the support you received?".

The requester wants to voice their disappointment or frustration with a service, product (excepting software products), or company. They may be complaining about poor customer service, unfair policies, poor overall experience, or perceived unfairness in games or betting. For example, "I feel cheated by this casino." or "I'm done with this company due to lack of response.".

The requester wants to express appreciation or share a positive experience they've had with the company, product (excepting software products), or service. They might be praising specific staff members, highlighting excellent customer service, or commending the quality of products. For example, "I wanted to express my sincere gratitude for the fantastic experience I've had." or "I just wanted to send a BIG thank you for all the fantastic work.".

The requester wants to offer suggestions or feedback to improve a product (excepting software products), service, or platform. The suggestions could include improvements to business practices, customer support, or general experience. For example, "It would be great if introducing more flexibility to handle leave requests for employees." or "I suggest you improve your customer service options.".

The requester is asking for a message or ticket to be handled, without providing any details on the type of the request being forwarded. For example, "Can you please help our agent solve this issue?" or "Please assist with the below request from our newsletter supplier.".

The requester is sending a document or attachment for various purposes. The purpose or type of document isn't specified. For example, "I'm attaching the requested form." or "Please find the required file attached.".

The requester is sharing a screenshot to illustrate an issue or provide visual information. They may be showing error messages, account details, confirmation emails, or other visual content to support their query or provide context. "We are now getting this error (see screenshot below).".

The requester is following up on a previous inquiry, request, or issue that hasn't been addressed or resolved. They're seeking a response, update, or action on their earlier communication. They're not explicitly reiterating their request. For example, "I sent an email two days ago and haven't heard back." or "Can someone please look into ticket that I submitted last week?".

The requester wants to cancel or ignore a previous message they sent. They may have found a solution, changed their mind, or realized they made a mistake. For example, "Please ignore my last email." or "Kindly disregard the message I just sent.".

The requester receives an automated notification of a ticket that has been resolved. The contents of the ticket may vary. The message is formatted as a ticket form and contains indication of the status "resolved". The contents of the ticket may vary.

Intent Name: Confirm if this is a legitimate message
Intent Description: The requester wants to confirm the legitimacy of a communication they've received, which they suspect might be fraudulent or a scam. This can include emails, text messages, phone calls, or other forms of contact that seem unusual or potentially malicious. For example, "Is this email legitimate?" or "I got a strange text message, can you verify if it's real?".

The requester receives an automated acknowledgment that their support request, inquiry, or ticket has been received. This message typically includes a reference number, estimated response time, and instructions for follow-up. It doesn't provide a solution to the original request, but confirms it's in the system and will be addressed. For example, "Thanks for contacting us." or "We have received your contact.".

The requester receives an automated notification of a new message. The ticket typically does not include any details about the contents of the message. For example, "Someone has sent you a protected message." or "You have received an encrypted message from the email address below.".

Intent Name: Received communication intended for someone else
Intent Description: The requester reports that they've received a communication (email, letter, or message) that they believe was sent to them by mistake. They want to inform the sender of the error. There is no explicit request to ensure that their information is removed from the incorrect mailing list or database. For example, "I received an email about a subscription I never signed up for." or "A letter for the previous homeowner was delivered to my address.".

The requester receives an automated notification informing them that a document link has been shared with them. The message typically includes the name of the shared item and a link to access it online. For example, "Someone has shared their verified document with you" or "A secure document has been shared with you".
The requester wants to receive documents, tickets, or information specifically via email. For example, "Can you email me a copy of my tickets?" or "Please send the user manual to my email address.".

The requester wants to express gratitude or acknowledge receipt of information, services, or items. No other issue or concern is being expressed in the message. For example, "Thank you for your help." or "Received, thanks!".

The requester is notifying about or seeking assistance with emails that couldn't be delivered. This could include bounce-back messages, delivery failure notifications, or issues with sending emails to specific recipients. For example, "I received an undelivered mail returned to sender message." or "Some of my emails to buyers couldn't be sent due to policy violations.".

The requester has received an automated response informing them that the recipient is currently unavailable. These messages typically include information about the duration of absence, alternative contact details, or when the recipient will return to the office. For example, "I'm currently on leave until next week." or "I'm out of the office with limited access to email.".

The requester receives an invitation to attend or participate in an event, conference, workshop, or similar gathering. This may include details about the event, registration information, or requests for the recipient to present or contribute in some way. For example, "Join us for the Christmas charity mixer.".

The requester receives an unsolicited commercial email promoting products or offers. These emails typically come from businesses trying to engage customers or generate sales through email marketing campaigns.

The requester is contacting the company to propose a business partnership, collaboration, or service. This can include offers for guest posting, SEO services, sponsorships, or other business development opportunities. For example, "I'm reaching out to explore if there's interest from your company to be featured and promoted across our platform." or "We are exploring the opportunity to collaborate and refer our students to your institution.".

The requester isn't making a legitimate support request. Instead, this is likely spam, a phishing attempt, or other malicious communication that needs to be identified and filtered out. Examples include fake legal notices, scam attempts, inappropriate content, or messages with suspicious links. The message often contains terms like "urgent", "100% free", "act now" and suspicious URLs.

The requester is sending a video demonstrating a problem with their product. They're often responding to a specific request from customer support or following up on a previous conversation. For example, "I've recorded a video of the noise my washing machine makes during the spin cycle.".

The requester is sending an order confirmation. An order confirmation is a communication by the seller confirming that the order placed by the buyer is approved, processed, and that the goods are being prepared or services will be provided.

The requester is sending a Purchase Order (PO). A Purchase Order is an official document that a buyer sends to a seller to requisition goods or services. It contains details such as description, quantity, and price of the goods or services required, and may also include terms of billing and shipment.
The requester is concerned about an order that is significantly delayed. For example, "My order from last month still hasn't arrived.".

The requester wants to know their order status. For example, "Has my order been already shipped?" or "What is the status of my order, can I expect it to be ready next week? I didn't receive any confirmation.".

The requester wants to know how long does it usually take for the order to arrive. For example, "I need this item for Christmas. Is it possible for it to arrive this fast?" or "How long does it take for the order to arrive from London warehouse?".

The requester wants to modify the items or quantities in their order. This could include changing the item, size, color, or quantity, adding or removing items from the order. For example, "I ordered 5 of these, but instead I want just 3, please update it." or "I realized I don't need baby formula, just a normal powdered milk, can you change it for me?".

Intent Name: Place new order or how to place order
Intent Description: The requester wants to place a new order or is asking how to do it. For example "I want to place an order for this t-shirt, thank you!." or "How can I place an order for new socks on your website?".
The requester wants to get a quote for their order. For example "Can you provide a quote for adding 5 Photoshop licenses to our account?".

The requester is seeking advice on which product to purchase. For example, "What video camera would be best for recording music performances?" or "Can you recommend a lip liner to match my lipstick shade?".
The requester has received documentation involving product license, installation instructions and license key.

The requester wants to inform about items that were ordered but not received. This could include partial deliveries, missing components from a set, or completely absent items from an order. For example, "I ordered two units of the product, but instead I only received one.".

The requester has received an item that doesn't match what they ordered. This could include wrong sizes, colors, models, or entirely different products. For example, "I ordered size S, but instead I received XL." or "I ordered a 2025 model, but you've sent me a 2020 model." or "This isn't a product I ordered, it's something else!".

The requester wants to know if a specific service is offered by the company. This may include installation, maintenance, or specialized business support. For example, "Do you offer assembly service for the shed I want to purchase?" or "Can you provide a concierge service?".

The requester is unable to find expected content in their account, course, or application. This may include recordings, courses, videos, games, or other material that they have purchased, enrolled in, or created. For example, "The video I purchased isn't showing up in my account.".

The requester is experiencing problems playing or viewing videos that they recorded themselves. For example, "My recorded videos are not displaying correctly." or "I'm unable to open the video I filmed.".
The requester has lost data or is missing information. For example, "All my passwords are gone after getting a new phone.".

The requester wants to recover or restore data that has been lost, deleted, or overwritten. For example, "How can I recover data from a damaged drive?" or "I need assistance with retrieving deleted files.".

Intent Name: Feature activation or beta access request
Intent Description: The requester wants to activate or turn on a specific feature, functionality, or service within their system or platform. This could include various elements such as dashboards, security features, or access to specific tools. For example, "Can you please turn on the food dashboard for our location?" or "Please activate the virtual terminal feature on my account.".

The requester is experiencing an issue where a specific feature or functionality in an application or platform isn't working as expected. They may be encountering errors, unexpected behavior, or a complete lack of response when trying to use the feature. For example, "The search function isn't working." or "I can't rearrange pictures in the gallery section.".
The requester wants to propose a new feature or an improvement to an existing one. For example, "Can you add a dark mode option?" or "It would be helpful to have a bulk update feature.".

The requester wants to turn off or deactivate a specific feature, capability, or setting. This could include system functions, or other configurable options. For example, "Can you turn off the cascading absence marks feature?" or "Please deactivate the retrieval capability for this location.".

The requester is unable to find or access a specific feature, option, or section that they believe should be available in the application or website. For example, "I'm having trouble locating this feature in the software. Can you help?" or "It seems like a feature is missing from the software.".

The requester is reporting an error message or technical issue they've encountered while using a service or application, typically without further context. They're seeking assistance, explanation, or resolution for the problem. For example, "An error popped up while using the application. Please check the error message below.".

The requester is experiencing problems with a third-party integration. They're reporting that the integration isn't working as expected. For example, "The integration is no longer posting notifications.".

Intent Name: Unable to open or launch software
Intent Description: The requester reports an inability to open or launch a specific application or platform. They may encounter errors, blank screens, or other obstacles preventing normal use. For example, "The app won't open, it just shows a spinning wheel.".

The requester receives a log file generated by a software client application. This log contains detailed information about the client's performance, including user actions, errors, and other relevant data. For example, "We received a client log containing information that may assist us in resolving the issue with incorrect location tracking in the family locator app.".
The requester wants to turn on Single Sign-On (SSO) for a specific application or system. For example, "Can we turn on SSO for this application?

The requester is asking for login credentials or access details for a specific system or platform. This could be for new users, temporary access, or renewing existing credentials. For example, "Could you please create login credentials for this user?".

The requester is experiencing problems with being automatically logged out of an application or service. They're unable to stay logged in for extended periods, often being logged out after a short time or when closing and reopening the app. For example, "I can only stay logged in for a few minutes before being automatically logged out.".
The requester is sure their password is correct but can't log into their account. For example, "I know my password is right, but I still can't log in.".
The requester has forgotten their login ID or email address associated with their account. For example, "I forgot which email I used to register.".
The requester has forgotten or lost their password associated with their account. For example, "I forgot my password and can't log in.".

Intent Name: ID or email address not recognized
Intent Description: The requester can't log in to their account because the system doesn't recognize their login ID or email address. For example, "I can't access my account because it doesn't recognize my email address.".
The requester is seeking assistance to change their password for their account. For example, "How do I change my password?".

The requester is sometimes able to log in but encounters issues at other times. For example, they can access their account on one platform but have trouble logging in on another. For example, "I can login on my phone but not on my TV.".
The requester can't log in to their account because the system doesn't accept their password. For example, "My password isn't working on any of my devices.".

The requester needs to reset their password because they've forgotten it, been locked out of their account, or their password has expired. For example, "Can you reset my password? I've been locked out of my account.".
The requester mention that they can't log into their account or access a specific system without providing further details. For example, "I can't log in to my account.".

The requester is unable to reset their password due to issues such as not receiving reset emails or reset links not working properly. For example, "I'm not getting the reset email." or "The password reset link isn't working.".

The requester receives a notification regarding event monitoring alerts related to IT infrastructure and network devices. This can include performance metrics, security alerts, connectivity issues, or other system-generated updates. For example, "Monitoring Update: Database connection lost at 2 AM.".

The requester is experiencing performance issues with the software. They report problems such as long load times, delayed responses to user actions, or general sluggishness that impacts their work. For example, "The app takes forever to load pages." or "It's taking much longer than usual to process payments.".

The requester is experiencing issues with audio not working properly, such as stopping, stuttering, buzzing, or glitching in their recorded videos. For example, "The audio in my video is muffled and distorted." or "There's no sound when I play back my recording.".

The requester needs access for a user to a specific system, platform, or tool. For example, "We upgraded our subscription, but the additional seats are not active. Can you turn on access?" or "Please turn on access to the necessary tools for the employee below.".

The requester wants to add a new user to a specific account or platform. They typically provide the new user's name, email address, and sometimes their role or access level. For example, "Could you add a new user to our current subscription?".

The requester reports that a user isn't receiving an expected invitation email to set up an account or license. For example, "I haven't received the invitation email for my software seat. Can it be resent?".
The requester wants to modify accesses, permissions or roles on the system. For example, "Can you change my role to manager in the system?" or "Please give admin rights to these team members.".

The requester wants to know when a specific software version will be available for their device or operating system. For example, "When will the new version be released?" or "Is there an update planned for the latest operating system?".

The requester is having difficulty connecting an application or service. This could involve issues with remote desktop connections, API connections, database servers, or other integrations. For example, "I can't connect to the remote server." or "I'm having trouble linking the application to the database.".

The requester wants to know how to integrate different software, platforms, or services. For example, "How do I integrate this service into my website?" or "What steps are needed to integrate these two applications?".

Intent Name: Software is crashing or not responding
Intent Description: The requester is experiencing software crashes, freezes, or loading issues that prevent them from using the program as intended. This can include applications becoming unresponsive, closing unexpectedly, or failing to load properly. For example, "The application crashed and won't reopen." or "I'm stuck in a loading loop and can't access the software.".

The requester is experiencing problems with a website that is crashing or not functioning properly. They may encounter error messages, slow loading times, or complete inability to access the site. For example, "The website keeps crashing and won't load." or "I'm getting an error message when trying to access the site.".
The requester wants to know how to edit data within a system. This can include modifying metadata, digital files, or other information. For example, "How do I edit the data in my files?".

Intent Name: Request access to file or folder
Intent Description: The requester is asking to grant access to a specific file or folder. This could include access to shared drives, databases, or other digital resources. For example, "Can I get access to the shared folder?" or "How do I access the specific document I need?".

The requester wants to delete specific data or records from their account or system. This can include various types of data such as files, entries, or archived records. For example, "Can you remove the files from this directory?".

The requester can't access or open a link they've been provided. This could be due to various reasons such as broken links, permission issues, or technical glitches. For example, "The link you sent isn't working." or "I can't open the shared document.".

The requester is unable to access a specific resource or system, such as shared folders or documents, files, timetables, or records, and seeks assistance in resolving the issue. For example, "I can't access my documents folder.".

The requester can't open various types of files or documents, including PDFs, zipped folders, or attachments. Files may appear blank or prompt unexpected error messages. For example, "I can't open the file.".
The requester can't create data. For example: "I can't create a new receipt.".

The requester can't download data and is experiencing issues such as error messages, slow downloads, or incomplete files. For example, "The file isn't available for download." or "The download is taking too long to complete.".

The requester is experiencing difficulties editing or modifying data in various systems or platforms. They may be encountering permission issues, technical glitches, or user interface problems that prevent them from making the desired changes. For example, "I'm unable to update my account information." or "I can't edit the data entry in the system.".

The requester can't find specific data they expect to have access to. This could include files, reports, or other important information within various systems or platforms. For example, "I can't find the report I saved.".

The requester can't upload data and is experiencing issues with the upload process. This can include problems with files taking too long or failing to upload. For example, "The upload is taking too long." or "I can't upload the file.".

The requester wants to know if a specific feature or functionality is available in a software application or system. They're asking about the possibility of performing certain actions, accessing specific information, or customizing the system in a particular way. For example, "Does the software allow for data export?" or "Can I customize the dashboard layout?".

The requester needs information about the software, including instructions on how to use its various features and functions. For example, "How do I adjust the settings?" or "Can you explain how to navigate the interface?".

The requester wants to know how to allow access to trusted email addresses, IP addresses, domain names, services or applications. For example, "Can you allow these IP addresses for our branches to connect to our system?".

The requester wants to report or inquire about vulnerabilities or potential weakness in the security system. For example, "Why isn't my password being protected as expected?" or "These emails are phishing attacks and they're not being detected as such".

The requester needs an update for a software, application, or system. This can include installing new versions or applying patches. For example, "We are currently running the X version of the software, but would like to update to XX, could you help us perform the update?".

The requester is experiencing problems with data not syncing correctly between different systems, applications, or devices. This can include issues with calendar syncing, order synchronization, password syncing, time synchronization, or data transfer between integrated platforms. For example, "My drive isn't syncing files." or "The API integration isn't syncing metadata fields correctly.".

The requester wants to import or export data between different systems, applications, or accounts. For example, "How can I export my passwords from the browser to the password management app?" or "I need to import data from one software to another.".

The requester is experiencing visual problems with their software interface. They may be seeing unexpected elements, overlapping text, or obstructive boxes that interfere with normal use. For example, "There's a blue box on my screen that's very distracting." or "The main menu is displaying with overwritten lines.".
